p: Lonicera japonica is the conventional remedy for curing sores, infection diseases, exopathogenic wind-heat, wounds, and furuncles. Homogenous RG-I polysaccharides were obtained and purified from the flowers of L. japonica, and their structure and influence on the activity of pancreatic cells were investigated. The polysaccharide was described as an RG-I backbone. Its monosaccharide composition presented galacturonic acid, rhamnose, arabinose, and galactose. The polysaccharide demonstrated high inhibition regarding the proliferation of pancreatic cancer cell BxPC-3 and PANC-1, while a weak cytotoxicity of the live cells was observed. The study suggests that pectic polysaccharide from flowers of L. japonica could be a powerful novel medicine for pancreatic cancer [ 96].
